column4: hi guys, i have a server that is running dapper, and i want to install a newer version of php, what is the best "ubuntu" way to do this?
search synaptic is one way. there is no "best" anything
thing is that the version in the rep is way old
then find a repo with a newer version or install a .deb file manually
try:    file <file you are curious of>
it may tell you
http://www.fileinfo.com/extension/fdf
So, I need acrobat reader?  Or what?
wekk, any PDF reader will do
The link shows only Mac and MS Windows...  But I'm trying to open the link with xpdf and nothing's happening.
well if you install adobes pdf viewer (not open source) on your system, you have as good as a windows user
Ok, will do that
what is the output of: sudo apt-get update    plase use: http://pastie.org to give the output

ok then run: sudo apt-get -y upgrade    is it ok?
you think that will fix the 'issue' ?

config ;)
